channel.title: People or puppets?
channel.description:
Discussions of values and ethics, modern versus traditional. Faculty from Union Theological Seminary, authors Kenneth Burke and Geoffrey Wagner, critics Edmund Fuller and Martin Dworkin, Dr. Solon Kimball and broadcaster Edward Stanley are featured.,Discussions of values and ethics, modern versus traditional. Some guests featured in the series include faculty from Union Theological Seminary, authors Kenneth Burke and Geoffrey Wagner, critics Edmund Fuller and Martin Dworkin, Dr. Solon Kimball and broadcaster Edward Stanley.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Are you just getting the facts Ma'am?
item.description: Are you just getting the facts, Ma'am? Sensationalism in the press.
item.dc:creator: Gelb, Philip

item.title: Is the good life good enough?
item.description: Is the good life good enough? Religion that gets results.

item.title: How will you have your hero?
item.description: How will you have your hero? Celebrity gods and religious figures.

item.title: What's in it for me?
item.description: What's in it for me? The media's portrayal of self in society.

item.title: Are you engaged in the pursuit of misery?
item.description: Are you engaged in the pursuit of misery? The popularity of pain and suffering.

item.description: A disccusion about sex and the mass media.

item.description: So what's so funny? The sick joke and the functions of humor.

item.description: Do you want to get away from it all? Analysis of our adjustment to routine, boredom and escape.

item.title: What kind of adventure stories do you like?
